definition: nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
householder who refuses to vacate his home despite pressure from property developers
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
that clinches it/that's final/no two ways about it
that clinches it/that's final/no two ways about it
lit. a soft nail/fig. a tactful retort or rejection

sentences.english: By putting the seven great nails on the narrow paths of samsara and nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 將七根大釘釘於輪迴與涅盤之狹路上。

sentences.english: The rafters, spaced at approximately 80cm centers, are nailed to the purlin.
sentences.chinese: 椽子釘在連繫樑上，中心間距爲80釐米。

sentences.english: On a bed of nails awake.
First hold the nail with the wide head by its shaft and push it head-first into the ball of clay.
sentences.chinese: 首先將寬頭釘的杆豎起，將其頭朝下推入橡皮泥球。

sentences.english: The tent-shaped huts are made out of logs hammered together, which rest on floating barrels.
sentences.chinese: 那些帳篷狀的棚屋由原木捶釘而成並依靠浮筒漂浮。

sentences.english: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God.
sentences.chinese: 他因軟弱被釘在十字架上，卻因神的大能，仍然活着。

sentences.english: Rock climbers descend the spire of Tricouni Nail in the Needles of South Dakota Black Hills.
sentences.chinese: 南達科他州黑崗石林裏，攀巖者從三齒釘山尖下滑。

sentences.english: He ran a nail into the wall to hang his painting.
sentences.chinese: 他在牆上釘了一個釘子掛上他的繪畫。

sentences.english: Nail in the Needles of South Dakota Black Hills.
sentences.chinese: 南達科他州黑崗石林裏，攀巖者從三齒釘山尖下滑。

sentences.english: The second baseman sharpened his spikes before every game.
sentences.chinese: 那個二壘守壘員每場比賽前都要磨尖他的鞋釘。

sentences.english: The box was corded, the card nailed on .
sentences.chinese: 箱子用繩捆好，上面釘了名片。

sentences.english: To observe the effect of the nonunion of humeral shaft fracture treated by bidentate intramedullary locking nails.
sentences.chinese: 探討分叉交鎖髓內釘治療肱骨幹骨折不癒合的療效。

sentences.english: The third generation nails are safe and reliable implants.
sentences.chinese: 第三代髓內釘系統更安全可靠。

sentences.english: His family's photos were pinned up over his bed.
sentences.chinese: 他家的照片釘在他的牀上方。

sentences.english: Old pitons should not be reused once they fall out.
sentences.chinese: 老舊的巖釘一旦脫出之後，就不得重新加以使用。

sentences.english: One by one, I nailed the rafters atop the stud walls while standing inside the 5 x 8–foot house, alongside the mature tree trunk.
sentences.chinese: 圍繞着粗壯的樹幹，我把椽釘到立柱牆頂部。

definition: pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
